title: Justice & Courts Commandments Quiz - Biblical Commands About Justice & Courts
description: Test your knowledge of the 70 biblical commandments related to justice & courts. Covers 31 positive and 39 negative commandments from the Torah.

questions.question: Which commandment requires the court to fine a man who seduces a maiden who is not engaged?
options: The court must fine one who sexually seduces a maiden
The court must judge the damages incurred by fire
Do not commit injustice with scales and weights
questions.correctAnswer: The court must fine one who sexually seduces a maiden
questions.explanation: Commandment #131 is a positive commandment requiring the court to fine a man who seduces a virgin who is not engaged, as stated in Exodus 22:16.

questions.question: What is the nature (positive or negative) of the commandment 'Do not accept monetary restitution to atone for a murderer'?
questions.correctAnswer: Negative
questions.explanation: Commandment #483 is negative, forbidding accepting ransom for the life of a murderer, as stated in Numbers 35:31.

questions.question: In which book is the commandment 'Appoint judges' found?
questions.correctAnswer: Deuteronomy
questions.explanation: Commandment #540 requires appointing judges and is found in Deuteronomy 16:18.

questions.question: Which commandment prohibits possessing inaccurate scales and weights, even if not for use?
options: Do not possess inaccurate scales and weights even if they are not for use
Each individual must ensure that his scales and weights are accurate
Do not move a boundary marker to steal someone's property
questions.correctAnswer: Do not possess inaccurate scales and weights even if they are not for use
questions.explanation: Commandment #471 is negative and forbids having differing weights in your bag, as per Deuteronomy 25:13.

questions.question: What punishment method is NOT commanded for courts to carry out in this category?
questions.correctAnswer: Exile to foreign land
questions.explanation: The courts are commanded to carry out death penalties by stoning (#545), burning (#546), decapitation (#547), strangulation (#548), and lashing (#553), but exile to a foreign land is not mentioned as a court punishment in this category.

questions.question: What is the commandment number for 'The court must judge the damages incurred by fire'?
questions.explanation: Commandment #466 requires the court to judge damages caused by fire and is found in Exodus 22:6.

questions.question: Which commandment forbids delaying payment of wages beyond the agreed time?
options: Do not delay payment of wages past the agreed time
questions.correctAnswer: Do not delay payment of wages past the agreed time
questions.explanation: Commandment #519 is negative and forbids withholding wages, as stated in Leviticus 19:13.

questions.question: Which commandment mandates that a judge must not show partiality to the poor or the great in judgment?
options: A judge must not pity the murderer or assaulter at the trial
A judge must not have mercy on the poor man at the trial
A judge must not respect the great man at the trial
questions.correctAnswer: Judge righteously
questions.explanation: Commandment #563 is positive and commands judging fairly without partiality, as found in Leviticus 19:15.

questions.question: Which commandment forbids moving a neighbor's boundary marker to steal property?
options: Do not move a boundary marker to steal someone's property
Do not commit injustice with scales and weights
questions.correctAnswer: Do not move a boundary marker to steal someone's property
questions.explanation: Commandment #472 forbids altering boundary markers as theft, according to Deuteronomy 19:14.

questions.question: What must the court do with a false witness according to the commandments?
options: Punish the false witnesses as they tried to punish the defendant
questions.correctAnswer: Punish the false witnesses as they tried to punish the defendant
questions.explanation: Commandment #577 requires punishing false witnesses as they intended harm to others, per Deuteronomy 19:19.

questions.question: Which commandment commands that the executed must be buried on the same day they are killed?
options: Bury the executed on the day they are killed
The court must not delay burial overnight
The court must carry out death penalty of stoning
The court must implement punitive measures against a thief
questions.correctAnswer: Bury the executed on the day they are killed
questions.explanation: Commandment #550 is positive and commands burial on the same day, as stated in Deuteronomy 21:23.

questions.question: According to the commandments, what should be done if a man opens a pit and an ox falls in?
options: The court must judge the damages incurred by a pit
The court must not take any action
The ox owner must pay a fine
questions.correctAnswer: The court must judge the damages incurred by a pit
questions.explanation: Commandment #465 requires the court to judge damages caused by an uncovered pit, from Exodus 21:33.

questions.question: Which commandment forbids accepting testimony from a lone witness?
options: Do not accept testimony from a lone witness
questions.correctAnswer: Do not accept testimony from a lone witness
questions.explanation: Commandment #573 forbids reliance on a single witness, requiring at least two or three, as in Deuteronomy 19:15.

questions.question: Which commandment states that the court must implement laws concerning the hired worker or guard?
options: The courts must carry out the laws of a hired worker and hired guard
Do not delay payment of wages
The court must implement punitive measures against a thief
questions.correctAnswer: The courts must carry out the laws of a hired worker and hired guard
questions.explanation: Commandment #517 requires courts to enforce laws related to hired workers or guards, from Exodus 22:10.

questions.question: What is forbidden by the commandment stated in Leviticus 19:35 regarding scales and weights?
options: Do not commit injustice with scales and weights
Each individual must ensure that his scales and weights are accurate
questions.correctAnswer: Do not commit injustice with scales and weights
questions.explanation: Commandment #470 forbids dishonest use of scales and weights, according to Leviticus 19:35.

questions.question: Which commandment is a positive commandment that requires punishing the guilty by lashes but limits the number to 40?
options: The court must give lashes to the wrongdoer
The court must carry out the death penalty of decapitation
The court must not kill anybody on circumstantial evidence
Do not delay payment of wages
questions.correctAnswer: The court must give lashes to the wrongdoer
questions.explanation: Commandment #553 instructs the court to administer lashes, no more than 40, from Deuteronomy 25:3.

questions.question: Which negative commandment forbids judges from accepting bribes?
options: A judge must not pity the murderer
questions.correctAnswer: Judges must not accept bribes
questions.explanation: Commandment #565 prohibits judges from accepting bribes to ensure justice, as per Exodus 23:8.

questions.question: Which commandment commands to prepare cities of refuge and roads leading to them?
options: Designate cities of refuge and prepare routes of access
The court must send the accidental murderer to a city of refuge
Do not kill a murderer before trial
Break the neck of a calf by the river valley following an unsolved murder
questions.correctAnswer: Designate cities of refuge and prepare routes of access
questions.explanation: Commandment #490 requires preparation of cities of refuge and access roads, from Deuteronomy 19:3.

questions.question: True or False: Commandment #573 states that testimony from a single witness is sufficient for conviction.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Commandment #573 forbids accepting testimony from a lone witness, requiring multiple witnesses, as in Deuteronomy 19:15.

questions.question: True or False: According to the commandments, a judge must fear a violent man when delivering judgment.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Commandment #564 instructs judges not to fear violent persons in judgment, per Deuteronomy 1:17.

questions.question: True or False: The court must not kill anyone based solely on circumstantial evidence.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Commandment #555 forbids killing anyone on circumstantial evidence, as stated in Exodus 23:7.

questions.question: True or False: It is permitted to delay burial of an executed person overnight according to the commandments.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Commandment #551 forbids delaying burial overnight, requiring burial on the day of execution, from Deuteronomy 21:23.

questions.question: True or False: The court must not allow a sorceress to live.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Commandment #552 is negative and commands that a sorceress must not be allowed to live, from Exodus 22:18.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: The court must not execute through a majority of one; at least a majority of ___ is required.
questions.correctAnswer: Two
questions.explanation: Commandment #543 requires at least a majority of two for execution decisions, found in Exodus 23:2.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: The court must implement punitive measures against a ___ according to Exodus 22:1.
questions.correctAnswer: Thief
questions.explanation: Commandment #468 instructs courts to punish thieves, requiring restitution, as in Exodus 22:1.
